text: Paula Valenska (born 2 July 1922) is a retired Czech actress noted for her roles in 1940s films.Chibnall & McFarlane p.322 After appearing in several films in her native Czechoslovakia she went to Britain to star in two films produced by Anatole de Grunwald. ==Selected filmography== * Spring Song (1944) * Saturday (1945) * No Surgery Hours Today (1948) * Bond Street (1948) * Golden Arrow (1949) == References == == Bibliography == * Chibnall, Steve & McFarlane, Brian. The British 'B' Film. Palgrave MacMillan, 2009. == External links == * Category:1922 births Category:Possibly living people Category:Czechoslovak emigrants to the United Kingdom Category:Czech film actresses Category:People from Mělník Category:Czech emigrants to the United Kingdom
title: Paula Valenska
